content: The "Cuban Humanitarian Trade Act of 1997" allows for the export of food, medicines, medical supplies, instruments, and equipment to Cuba without any embargo restrictions. The "Cuban Humanitarian Trade Act of 1997" allows for the export of food, medicines, medical supplies, instruments, and equipment to Cuba without any embargo restrictions. Upon enactment, existing restrictions on trade with Cuba regarding exports of specified items and travel related to them will no longer apply. After the enactment of the "Cuban Humanitarian Trade Act of 1997," the President is limited in restricting the exportation of food, medicines, medical supplies, instruments, and equipment to Cuba under specific conditions outlined in the Act. The Cuban Democracy Act of 1992 is amended to allow exports of food to Cuba and not restrict exports of medicines and medical supplies to Cuba. The President must submit a report to Congress before imposing restrictions on exports under certain conditions, including the likelihood of the item being used for torture, reexported, or in the production of biotechnological products. The President must submit a report to Congress detailing restrictions on exports, including reasons for the restrictions. Additionally, subsections in the Cuban Democracy Act are amended to allow exports of food to Cuba. SEC. 6. Application of denial of foreign tax credit with respect to Cuba: Amends section 901(j)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code to exempt Cuba from the denial of foreign tax credit for income, war profits, or excess profits taxes paid to Cuba related to permitted exports or travel under the Cuban Humanitarian Trade Act of 1997. SEC. 7. INAPPLICABILITY OF OTHER RESTRICTIONS. This Act and its amendments apply despite section 102(h) of the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996. SEC. 8. REPORT TO CONGRESS. The President must report to Congress within 6 months of this Act's enactment on sales of food, medicines, and medical supplies to Cuba, including details on types of goods exported and any misuse or reexportation.
